data.title: Jim Cramer says the market will stay volatile but sees chances to buy some tech, dividend stocks
data.text: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer breaks down Wednesday's trading day and told investors there is likely to be more volatility ahead. But Cramer recommended buying large tech stocks like Microsoft if it pulls back further while adding dividend-yielding stocks like PepsiCo to portfolios.

data.title: Why Apple Stock Fell Today
data.text: A new analyst says investors' expectations for the tech giant may be too high.

data.title: Indian Expansion And Incoming iPhones Say Buy Apple Stock
data.text:
AAPL stock got a bump on Monday after several weeks of decline, after the company announced launch of online store for India.
The post Indian Expansion And Incoming iPhones Say Buy Apple Stock appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Apple Stock Downgraded On Mature Hardware Businesses
data.text: An investment bank lowered its rating on Apple on Wednesday, saying its recent valuation increase isn't justified, given the company's mature hardware businesses. Apple stock fell.

data.title: Implied Volatility Surging for Apple (AAPL) Stock Options

data.title: Apple stock drops after downgrade at UBS
data.text: UBS downgraded Apple Inc. shares AAPL, -0.17% late Tuesday as analyst David Vogt assumed coverage of the company and lowered UBS's rating to neutral from buy.

data.title: Apple Is Down Nearly 20% From Its Post-Split High: Time to Buy?
data.text: It's been an up-and-down ride for investors. Here's a look at what happened in the months after previous splits, and the company's prospects today.

data.title: Apple finally launched an online store in India
data.text: It's been 20 years since Apple entered India. Now the company is finally starting to sell directly to customers.

data.title: Apple launches its online store in India
data.text: For the first time in more than 20 years since Apple began its operations in India, the iPhone-maker has started selling its products directly to consumers in the world’s second largest smartphone market. Apple launched its online store in India on Wednesday, which in addition to offering nearly the entire line-up of its products, also […]
